result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ibbin Lee Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ibbin Lee Harris in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Ibbin Lee Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court on Attorney Wait's motion to withdraw.  Court granted motion to withdraw.  Case is adjourned to 11-7-22 at 8:30 am for status of counsel.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ibbin Lee Harris not in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Ibbin Lee Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Attorney Wait's Motion to Withdraw.  Defendant does not appear.  Court will not allow Attorney Wait to withdraw today due to defendant not appearing.  At the request of the defense and without objection from the State, Court ordered jury trial date of 10-19-22 be vacated and converted to a Motion to Withdraw.  Case is adjourned to 10-19-22 at 8:30 for a Motion to Withdraw.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case is scheduled for a Motion to Withdraw on 9-27-22 at 1:30 pm.
Notice of Motion to Withdraw, filed.

Defendant Ibbin Lee Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Ibbin Lee Harris.  Prosecuting Attorney Michelle Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 10-19-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.

Defendant Ibbin Lee Harris in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court further orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 10. This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is in the courthouse but unable to appeary by zoom today.  Court waived defendant's appearance.  Parties are still negotiating and requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 8-16-22 at 2:00 pm for a status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Rosa.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Havas, Branch 10.

Defendant Ibbin Lee Harris in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 10.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is requesting a substitution of judge.  Returned address 2809 N. 20th St. Milwaukee, WI 53206

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with I.S.J.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ibbin Lee Harris in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
